meanings.definition: A person or thing that gushes.
meanings.sent1: The little girl was a gusher of laughter, always giggling and smiling.
meanings.sent2: The waterfall was a beautiful gusher of water, flowing gracefully down the rocks.
meanings.sent3: The gusher of compliments from her friends made her blush.
meanings.sent4: Her happiness was like a gusher, bubbling up uncontrollably.
meanings.sent5: His enthusiasm for the project was a gusher, inspiring everyone around him.

meanings.definition: A sudden and abundant flow of liquid.
meanings.sent1: The burst pipe caused a gusher of water to flood the basement.
meanings.sent2: The oil rig experienced a gusher of crude oil, creating a mess.
meanings.sent3: The soda can exploded, creating a sticky gusher all over the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The fountain in the park shot up like a gusher, surprising the children nearby.
meanings.sent5: The burst dam unleashed a gusher of water, overwhelming the town below.

meanings.definition: A well that produces oil or gas in large quantities.
meanings.sent1: The new oil well turned out to be a gusher, bringing wealth to the town.
meanings.sent2: The gusher in the desert attracted many oil companies looking to strike it rich.
meanings.sent3: The gusher in the backyard turned out to be a hidden oil well, much to everyone's surprise.
meanings.sent4: The gusher at the drilling site was a sign of a successful operation.
meanings.sent5: The gusher at the oil field was a sight to behold, spouting oil high into the sky.
